intro: Merremia macrocarpa, commonly known as the giant morning glory, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant produces large, round fruits that can grow up to 15 centimeters in diameter, containing numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to various parts of the world.
